meanings.definition: A unit of liquid measure equal to half a Scottish pint.
meanings.sent1: I poured a mutchkin of milk into the recipe.
meanings.sent2: She only needed a mutchkin of water to quench her thirst.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse drank a mutchkin of juice and grew twice its size!
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like a mutchkin of water in a vast desert.
meanings.sent5: The mutchkin of oil spilled on the floor created a slippery mess.

meanings.sent1: He added a mutchkin of sugar to his coffee.
meanings.sent2: There was only a mutchkin of patience left in her after a long day.
meanings.sent3: The mutchkin of coins in his pocket jingled as he walked.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a mutchkin of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The mutchkin of stars in the sky twinkled brightly.
